info.description:
Documentation for the [Affinda API](https://github.com/affinda/affinda-api-spec).
# Quickstart
* Obtain an [API key](https://affinda.com/resume-parser/free-api-key/)
* (Recommended) Download and install one of our client libraries:
  * [Python](https://github.com/affinda/affinda-python) : `pip install affinda`
  * [Javascript](https://github.com/affinda/affinda-typescript) : `npm install @affinda/affinda`
  * [C# - coming soon](https://github.com/affinda/affinda-csharp)
  * [Java - coming soon](https://github.com/affinda/affinda-java)

* Without a client library, API requests via HTTP can be made as defined below
info.title: Affinda API

tags.name: Parser
tags.description: Operations available to perform on parsed resumes

tags.name: Redactor
tags.description: Operations available to perform on redacted resumes

tags.name: Reformatter
tags.description: Operations available to perform on reformatted resumes

get.description: Returns all the resume summaries for that user, limited to 300 per page.

x-codeSamples.label: Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from affinda import AffindaAPI, TokenCredential

token = "REPLACE_TOKEN"

credential = TokenCredential(token=token)
client = AffindaAPI(credential=credential)
all_resumes = client.get_all_resumes()

print(all_resumes.as_dict())

x-codeSamples.label: Shell + curl
x-codeSamples.source:
TOKEN="REPLACE_TOKEN"

curl --request GET --location \
  --url "https://api.affinda.com/v1/resumes" \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN"

x-codeSamples.label: Node JS

post.description:
Uploads a resume for parsing.
When successful, returns an `identifier` in the response for subsequent use with the [/resumes/{identifier}](#operation/getResume) endpoint to check processing status and retrieve results.

200.description: Only returned when wait=True, will return the created resume

201.description: Only returned when wait=False, will return  uploaded and identifier created
201.x-summary: Document uploaded and created, use resume.meta.identifier to poll for processing status

requestBody.description: Resume to upload, either via fileupload or URL to a file

x-codeSamples.label: Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from pathlib import Path

from affinda import AffindaAPI, TokenCredential

token = "REPLACE_TOKEN"
file_pth = Path("path_to_file")

credential = TokenCredential(token=token)
client = AffindaAPI(credential=credential)

with open(file_pth, "rb") as f:
    resume = client.create_resume(file=f)

print(resume.as_dict())

x-codeSamples.label: Shell + curl
x-codeSamples.source:
TOKEN="REPLACE_TOKEN"

PATH_TO_FILE="/path/to/file.pdf"

curl --request POST "https://api.affinda.com/v1/resumes/" \
  --location --compressed \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" \
  --header "Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate" \
  --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
  --form "file=@$PATH_TO_FILE" \
  --header "accept: */*" \

x-codeSamples.label: Node JS

get.summary: Gets parse results for a specific resume
get.description:
Returns all the parse results for that resume if processing is completed.
The `identifier` is the unique ID returned after POST-ing the resume via the [/resumes](#operation/createResume) endpoint.

x-codeSamples.label: Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from affinda import AffindaAPI, TokenCredential

token = "REPLACE_TOKEN"
identifier = "REPLACE_IDENTIFIER"

credential = TokenCredential(token=token)
client = AffindaAPI(credential=credential)
resume = client.get_resume(identifier=identifier)

print(resume.as_dict())

x-codeSamples.label: Shell + curl
x-codeSamples.source:
TOKEN="REPLACE_TOKEN"
IDENTIFIER="REPLACE_IDENTIFIER"

curl --request GET --location \
  --url "https://api.affinda.com/v1/resumes/$IDENTIFIER" \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN"

x-codeSamples.label: Node JS

delete.description: Deletes the specified resume from the database

identifier = "REPLACE_IDENTIFIER"

get.summary: Gets list of all redacted resumes
get.description: Returns all the redacted resume information for that resume

x-codeSamples.source:

curl --request GET --location \

x-codeSamples.label: Node JS

200.description: Only returned when wait=True, will return the created redacted resume

201.description: When successful, returns an `identifier` in the response for subsequent use with the [/redacted_resumes/{identifier}](#operation/getRedactedResume) endpoint to check processing status and retrieve results.
201.x-summary: Document uploaded and created, use redacted_resume.meta.identifier to poll for processing status

requestBody.description: Resume to upload, either via fileupload or URL to a file

redactPersonalDetails.description: Whether to redact personal details (e.g. name, address)

redactWorkDetails.description: Whether to redact work details (e.g. company names)

redactEducationDetails.description: Whether to redact education details (e.g. university names)

client = AffindaAPI(credential=credential)

x-codeSamples.source:

200.description: Only returned when wait=True, will return the created reformatted resume

201.description: When successful, returns an `identifier` in the response for subsequent use with the [ /reformatted_resumes/{ identifier } ](#operation/getReformattedResume) endpoint to check processing status and retrieve results.
201.x-summary: Document uploaded and created, use reformatted_resume.meta.identifier to poll for processing status

requestBody.description: Resume resume to upload, either via a binary file or URL to a file

x-codeSamples.label: Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from pathlib import PathAdding basic test suite

from affinda import TokenCredential, AffindaAPI

token = "REPLACE_TOKEN"
resume_format = "REPLACE_FORMAT_IDENTIFIER"
file_pth = Path("path_to_file")

credential = TokenCredential(token=token)
client = AffindaAPI(credential=credential)

with open(file_pth, "rb") as f:
    reformatted_resume = client.create_reformatted_resume(file=f,
                                                          file_name=file_pth.name,
                                                          resume_format=resume_format)

print(reformatted_resume.as_dict())

x-codeSamples.label: Shell + curl
x-codeSamples.source:
TOKEN="REPLACE_TOKEN"
RESUME_FORMAT="Affinda"

PATH_TO_FILE="/path/to/file.pdf"

curl --request POST "https://api.affinda.com/v1/reformatted_resumes/" \
  --location --compressed \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" \
  --header "Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate" \
  --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
  --form "file=@$PATH_TO_FILE" \
  --form "resumeFormat=$RESUME_FORMAT" \
  --header "accept: */*" \

x-codeSamples.label: Node JS

ApiKeyAuth.description:
Basic authentication using an API key, e.g. `{Authorization: Bearer 75z0bb4fbdf97b7e4111ff6c0015471094155f91}`
You can obtain an API key [here](https://affinda.com/resume-parser/free-api-key/)

limitParam.name: limit
limitParam.description: The numbers of documents to return, defaults to 300.

offsetParam.name: offset
offsetParam.description: The number of documents to skip before starting to collect the result set.

detail.example: Invalid token header. No credentials provided.

Identifier.description: Unique identifier for the resume. If creating a document and left blank, one will be automatically generated.

ExpiryTime.description: The date/time in ISO-8601 format when the resume will be automatically deleted.  Defaults to no expiry.

ready.description: If true, the document has finished processing. Particularly useful if an endpoint request specified wait=False, when polling use this variable to determine when to stop polling

readyDt.description: The datetime when the document was ready

failed.description: If true, some exception was raised during processing. Check the 'error' field of the main return object.

UrlToProcess.description: URL to file to download and process

Wait.description: If "true" (default), will return a response only after processing has completed. If "false", will return an empty data object which can be polled at the GET endpoint until processing is complete.

ResumeLanguage.description: Language code in ISO 639-1 format. Must specify zh-cn or zh-tw for Chinese.

organization.example: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University (Virginia Tech)

inputStr.example: Bachelor of Science, Mechanical Engineering, expected

profession.description: Prediction of the candidate's profession based on recent work experience

jobDescription.example: Interned with supercar Development from May 2017 to August 2017.

example: Tim Smith et al., Investigations of nanoparticles in the pathology of the human eye, Cell 2014

text.example: Stephen Smith, Team Member/Mentor, Company Power Generation: stephen.smith@company.com

isResumeProbability.description: Probability that the given document is a resume. Values below 30 suggest that the resume is not a resume.

rawText.example: Christopher Nolan 3210 fake street ... <rest of resume text>
rawText.description: All of the raw text of the parsed resume, example is shortened for readiblity
